People with this form of the disorder do not develop secondary sex characteristics, such as increased body hair, at puberty. Some researchers refer to this form of Leydig cell hypoplasia as type 1 and designate less severe cases as type 2.",GHR,Leydig cell hypoplasia
How many people are affected by Leydig cell hypoplasia ?,Leydig cell hypoplasia is a rare disorder; its prevalence is unknown.,GHR,Leydig cell hypoplasia
